alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern New Castle, southeastern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Landenberg, or 9 miles north of Newark, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Westtown, Kennett Square, Arden, Greenville, Cheyney, North Star, Talleyville, Landenberg, Elam, Concordville, Hockessin, Ashland, Pike Creek, Chester Heights, Avondale, Bellefonte, Ardentown, Ardencroft and Toughkenamon. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 16 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
